parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>Command</title><part><name>Comments</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma3 </value></part><part><name>Game name</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value> 1.34 </value></part><part><name>Game version</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Ropes and Sling Loading </value></part><part><name>GROUP1</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Creates a sling loading from a helicopter to an entity if possible. To unload cargo, pass [[objNull]] as second param. <br><br>
<template lineStart="1"><title>Informative </title><part><name index="1"/><value> FROM object has to be a helicoper, alive with [[enableRopeAttach | rope attachment]] enabled, TO object has to be an entity, alive with [[enableRopeAttach | rope attachment]] enabled.</value></part></template></value></part><part><name>Description</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> heli [[setSlingLoad]] cargo </value></part><part><name>Syntax</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> heli: [[Object]] - the helicopter slinging the load

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> cargo: [[Object]] - the cargo load entity

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Boolean]] - [[true]] on success </value></part><part><name>Return value</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name>x1 </name>=<value> <code>_success = heli1 [[setSlingLoad]] veh1;</code> </value></part><part><name>Example1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>x2 </name>=<value> To unload cargo:<code>_success = heli [[setSlingLoad]] [[objNull]];</code></value></part><part><name>Example2</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value> [[ropes]], [[canSlingLoad]], [[enableRopeAttach]], [[getSlingLoad]], [[ropeAttachedObjects]], [[ropeAttachTo]], [[ropeDestroy]], [[ropeLength]], [[ropeUnwound]], [[ropeAttachedTo]], [[ropeCreate]], [[ropeDetach]], [[ropeAttachEnabled]], [[ropeCut]], [[ropeEndPosition]], [[ropeUnwind]], [[slingLoadAssistantShown]] </value></part><part><name>See also</name>=<value>
</value></part></template>

</comment><dl class="command_description">
<dd class="notedate">Posted on November 8, 2014 - 14:42 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Tajin|Tajin]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
"... if possible "<br>
FYI, that only means that 'vehicle' has to be able to lift 'cargo'. The position/distance does not matter, 'cargo' is automatically moved to a position that is close enough but doesn't doesn't collide with 'vehicle'. (can also be used if 'vehicle' is not flying, in which case 'cargo' will be placed and attached on the ground next to it).
</dd>
</dl>
